message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.CV. 

The paper proposes a framework for reinforcement learning that injects problem knowledge into policy gradient updates, which is relevant to several sub-categories. The use of self-performance assessment and accurate expectations suggests a focus on machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The experiments conducted on standard benchmark environments and transfer learning indicate a focus on robotics (cs.RO) and computer vision (cs.CV). The paper also discusses how the framework tackles the problem of reward sparsity, which is relevant to systems and control (cs.SY).
